bug.author: TommasoBendinelli
bug.description:
I am getting this error with a fresh install using the commands in the home page <denchmark-code># Here we assume CUDA 10.1 is installed. You should change the number # according to your own CUDA version (e.g. mxnet_cu100 for CUDA 10.0). python3 -m pip install --upgrade "mxnet_cu101<2.0.0" python3 -m pip install autogluon </denchmark-code>
And then <denchmark-code>from autogluon import TabularPrediction as task </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: This has been blocking our releases too.

I have reproduced the issue on a fresh machine and will deep dive: <denchmark-code>>>> from autogluon import TabularPrediction as task Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> ImportError: cannot import name 'TabularPrediction' from 'autogluon' (/home/ubuntu/virtual/autogluon_test/lib/python3.7/site-packages/autogluon/__init__.py) </denchmark-code>

Issue identified: gluoncv recently released v0.9.0 which depends on the pre-release autogluon.core module. AutoGluon has been changed to be a namespace package in preparation for v0.1 release, meaning it is now made up of several separate packages. However, having both autogluon==0.0.14 (non-namespace) and autogluon.core (namespace) installed creates a namespace collision. Because autogluon==0.0.14 installs 'gluoncv>=0.5.0,<1.0',, it installs the new gluoncv==0.9.0 which creates the namespace collision and breaks the package. The following installation process works: <denchmark-code># Optionally upgrade pip for faster install and newer mxnet version python3 -m pip install --upgrade pip
python3 -m pip install "mxnet<2.0.0" python3 -m pip install "gluoncv>=0.5.0,<0.9.0" python3 -m pip install autogluon </denchmark-code>
To fix a pre-existing broken environment: <denchmark-code>python3 -m pip uninstall autogluon.core python3 -m pip uninstall autogluon python3 -m pip uninstall gluoncv python3 -m pip install "gluoncv>=0.5.0,<0.9.0" python3 -m pip install autogluon </denchmark-code>
We will plan to release v0.0.15 ASAP (within the next 24 hours) to resolve this issue by updating the gluoncv version band to not include v0.9.0.

This issue has been fixed with the release of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/awslabs/autogluon/releases/tag/v0.0.15>v0.0.15</denchmark-link> . Please install the new version from a fresh environment to avoid any corruptions from prior installs. v0.0.15 should work identically to v0.0.14 minus the installation issue.
I can confirm this is resolved by v0.0.15.
This is the problem that bothered me for a few days. Now the problem is solved, thanks a lot :)
